Package controller

Class AppManager

java.lang.Object
controller.AppManager
public class AppManager extends Object
Main controller of store and managing menu inputs

    • loadToys

      public void loadToys()
      Use Toy class and convert each line from .txt file into a toy type based on first number of serial number and keep them in an array list.

      public void addToy() throws InvalidIntException

      InvalidIntException

      public void addToy(String serialNumber, String name, String brand, float price, int availableCount, int age, int mininumberofplayers, int maxnumberofplayer, String numOfDesigners)
      method that takes in the toy details as parameters and directly adds the toy to a list without any input validation or exception handling for the JUNIT.

    • removeToy

      public void removeToy() throws InvalidIntException
      Remove toy from the toys.txt file after showing user the toy based on serial number entered. If no toy match the Serial number then it shows message
      Throws:
      InvalidIntException

    • removeToy

      public void removeToy(Toy toy_)
      Parameters:
      toy_ -

    • removeToy

      public void removeToy(String serialNumber)
      method is used to remove a toy from the toyType list based on its serial number. It calls the findToyBySerialNumber() method to find the Toy object with the given serial number and then calls the second removeToy() method to remove the toy from the list.
      Parameters:
      serialNumber -

    • findToyBySerialNumber

      public Toy findToyBySerialNumber(String serialNumber)
      The findToyBySerialNumber() method looks for a toy that has a specific serial number in a list. If the toy is found, the method returns it. If it's not found, it returns null. The method uses a loop to check each toy's serial number in the list until it finds a match or reaches the end of the list.
      Parameters:
      serialNumber -
      Returns:
      toy found by serial number if found
